intro: Goodyera medogensis, commonly known as the Yunnan maidenhair fern, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, leathery leaves and intricate frond structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in mountainous regions with rich, humus-filled soil. Its spores are produced in specialized structures called sori, which are located on the underside of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Goodyera medogensis is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
